verses.text: My son, forget not my law; But let thine heart keep my commandments:
For length of days, and long life, And peace, shall they add to thee.
Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: Bind them about thy neck; Write them upon the table of thine heart:
So shalt thou find favour and good understanding In the sight of God and man.
Trust in the \sc Lord\sc* with all thine heart; And lean not unto thine own understanding.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, And he shall direct thy paths.
Be not wise in thine own eyes: Fear the \sc Lord\sc*, and depart from evil.
It shall be health to thy navel, And marrow to thy bones.
Honour the \sc Lord\sc* with thy substance, And with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
So shall thy barns be filled \add with\add* plenty, And thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
My son, despise not the chastening of the \sc Lord\sc*; Neither be weary of his correction:
For whom the \sc Lord\sc* loveth he correcteth; Even as a father the son \add in whom\add* he delighteth.
Happy \add is\add* the man \add that\add* findeth wisdom, And the man \add that\add* getteth understanding.
For the merchandise of it \add is\add* better than the merchandise of silver, And the gain thereof than fine gold.
She \add is\add* more precious than rubies: And all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
Length of days \add is\add* in her right hand; And in her left hand riches and honour.
Her ways \add are\add* ways of pleasantness, And all her paths \add are\add* peace.
She \add is\add* a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: And happy \add is\add* every one that retaineth her.
The \sc Lord\sc* by wisdom hath founded the earth; By understanding hath he established the heavens.
By his knowledge the depths are broken up, And the clouds drop down the dew.
My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: Keep sound wisdom and discretion:
So shall they be life unto thy soul, And grace to thy neck.
Then shalt thou walk \add in\add* thy way safely, And thy foot shall not stumble.
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: Yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Be not afraid of sudden fear, Neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
For the \sc Lord\sc* shall be thy confidence, And shall keep thy foot from being taken.
Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, When it is in the power of thine hand to do \add it\add*.
Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; When thou hast it by thee.
Devise not evil against thy neighbour, Seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
Strive not with a man without cause, If he have done thee no harm.
Envy thou not the oppressor, And choose none of his ways.
For the froward \add is\add* abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*: But his secret \add is\add* with the righteous.
The curse of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* in the house of the wicked: But he blesseth the habitation of the just.
Surely he scorneth the scorners: But he giveth grace unto the lowly.
The wise shall inherit glory: But shame shall be the promotion of fools.
